title: NFL Star Antonio Brown Lists Pittsburgh Mansion for $2.3M
text:
Antonio Brown, the American football star who has been rececently accused of sexual assault, has listed his suburban Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, mansion for $2.3 million.

The two-story brick house was custom built for Mr. Brown in 2014, said listing agent Shane Smith of Coldwell Banker, who has the listing with his wife, Amy, in partnership with Jordan Stuart of Next Move.



The house is in the Pine Township, Pennsylvania, community of Gibsonia, Mr. Smith said. “It’s a very, very desirable area of Pittsburgh, about 30 minutes north of the city.”

“It’s in a very small development with very large homes,” he said. “All of them are on over an acre of land—this one is three acres, which is a rare find in this area.”

More: Tom Brady and Gisele Bündchen Chop More Than $5M Off Boston-Area Home

The 8,797-square-foot house has five bedrooms, six full bathrooms and one partial bathroom. It was listed for sale on Friday.

Mr. Brown, 31, starred for the Steelers from 2010 through 2018. Earlier this year, he was traded to the Oakland Raiders but then cut before the season began over disagreements with management. The day he was dropped from the Raiders, Mr. Brown signed with the New England Patriots. However, he played only one game with the team before being cut over sexual assault allegations. Mr. Brown has denied any wrongdoing. He's currently a free agent.

He could not be reached for immediate comment.

The Pittsburgh house and property have “a lot of unique features,” Mr. Smith said.

More: Michael Jordan Lists Park City, Utah, Mansion for $7.5 Million

“The backyard is incredible,” he said, with a custom asphalt basketball court, a turf practice field, and, most notably, an over-the-top tree house custom built for Mr. Brown. “It’s two stories, all steel and glass construction.”

The tree house, which has been featured on the Animal Planet show “Treehouse Masters,” also boasts a sleeping loft, a living area with flat-screen TVs and a bar, and a bathroom with a steam shower.

The main house features a grand living room with a fireplace and a coffered ceiling, a family room with a stone fireplace, and a formal dining room with custom wainscoting and a tray ceiling. A separate study or office with built-ins is located off the family room.

The kitchen has an island, Thermador appliances and wood floors.

The master suite has a private balcony, a sitting area with a fireplace, and a large walk-in closet.



Other architectural and design details include hardwood floors, columns, a double-height foyer, and custom millwork.

The finished basement offers a home theater, gym, sauna, steam shower, and a full bath.



“Everything has been cleaned up and cut,” Mr. Smith said. “Every hedge, every bush and tree was trimmed up, and we added a ton of mulch to the landscaping.”
